1.  Introduction {.western style="page-break-before: always"}
    ============

1.  Purpose {.western}
    -------

This summary report is intended to summarize HIPAA Requirements
verification for Keep On Movin system.

2.  Scope {.western}
    -----

The scope of the analysis/verification and therefore of this report are
requirements technical safeguards of [HIPAA Security
Regulations](http://health.state.tn.us/hipaa/). The system was analysed
agains requirments for PHI data processing, transmitting, storing etc.
defined in [1] and aggregated in [2] of References section.

1.  Definitions {.western}
    -----------

      ----------------------------------------------------
      \#     Abbreviation   Definition
      ------ -------------- ------------------------------
      1.     PHI            Protected health information
                            
                            
      ----------------------------------------------------

2.  References {.western}
    ----------

      ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      \#     Version   Date         Document Name                                                                                                                     Published by
      ------ --------- ------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      1.     \         10/01/2010   [Technical safeguards](http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2010-title45-vol1/pdf/CFR-2010-title45-vol1-sec164-312.pdf)               [U.S. Government Publishing Office](http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/granule/CFR-2010-title45-vol1/CFR-2010-title45-vol1-sec164-308)
                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                      

      2.     \         \            [Security Standards: Technical Safeguards](http://www.hhs.gov/ocr/privacy/hipaa/administrative/securityrule/techsafeguards.pdf)   [U.S. Department of Health & Human Services](http://www.hhs.gov/ocr/privacy/hipaa/administrative/securityrule/techsafeguards.pdf)
                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                      

      3.     \         \            \                                                                                                                                 \
                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                      
      ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Project Description and High-level Requirements {.western}
===============================================

The puppose of the analysis was to verify if the system conforms to
requirments defined by HIPAA Security Regulations by doing both: code
review and application testing.

\
\

1.  Code Review Process {.western}
    -------------------

As part of the verification it was analysed the following parts of the
system:

-   iOS code

-   Server side Ruby code

-   Database (test data)

2.  Application testing Activities {.western}
    ------------------------------

During the analysis the following applications where analysed:

-   Admin console

-   iOS native application

3.  Assumptions and Limitations {.western}
    ===========================

The analysis was performed with the following asumtions and was
restricted by the following limitations:

-   The only part of PHI data the application operates with is a
    diagnosis (exposed in a form of patient comment)

-   Cloud deployments were not anlysed due to permissions restrictions

\
\

4.  The report {.western style="page-break-before: always"}
    ==========

**HIPAA Standards\
(sections)**

**Requirement**

**Admin 1 Status\
(http://komstaging.herokuapp.com)**

**Admin 2 Status\
(http://komdevelopment.herokuapp.com)**

**The Application\
Status**

[Access](http://www.gogrid.com/) Control

(164.312(a)(1))

Unique user identification

Implemented: there is login requiring username/password, but weak
passwords are allowed

Implemented: there is login requiring username/password, but weak
passwords are allowed

Implemented: there is login requiring username/password, but weak
passwords are allowed (passwords without special characters are passing)

Role-based security

Not implemented: roles are present, but seems not used

Implemented

NotApplicable

User credentials encryption

Not implemented: http protocol is used

Not implemented: http protocol is used

Implemented: data are passed via https protocol. The encryption method
was not verified since it depends on SSH certificate used for
communication. A certificate should be checked for each environment
individually.

Patient data encryption(optional)

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

Implemented

Remember me \
(to be turned off)

Implemented, but can be emulated using browser’s remember password
built-in feature

Implemented, but can be emulated using browser’s remember password
built-in feature

Implemented

Auto-logoff(optional)/session expiration

Implemented

Implemented

Implemented

Emergency access procedure

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

Security testing

No information available

No information available

No information available

[Audit](http://www.gogrid.com/) Controls\
(164.312(b))

Audit trail

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

Implemented: The audit is implemented and all required information are
there, but the form in which the information is saved might be hard to
analyze. In addition, some audit entries are missing part of information
(login action for example).

Access for not registered users

NotApplicable: all users are required to authentificate itself

NotApplicable: all users are required to authentificate itself

NotApplicable: all users are required to authentificate itself

Versioning

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

NotApplicable due to nature of PHI type of data the application is
working with

Patient data retention

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

? \
Non known at the moment (need further research on that) also not sure if
the client needs this due to nature of PHI type of data the application
is working with

Integrity (164.312(c)(1))

Data authentication

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

Backups

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

Implemented

Person or Entity Authentication\
(164.312(d))

Unique user identification

Implemented

Implemented

Implemented

Authentication with 3rd party software

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

NotApplicable

Transmission Security\
(164.312(e)(1))

Integrity Controls

Not implemented: http protocol is used

Not implemented: http protocol is used

Implemented

Encryption

Not implemented: http protocol is used

Not implemented: http protocol is used

Implemented: data are passed via https protocol. The encryption method
was not verified since it depends on SSH certificate used for
communication. A certificate should be checked for each environment
individually.
